Posts.Content: CGA wrote: Hi all, I have been reading her for the last four weeks. My good friend (my heart) was diagnosed four weeks ago with Stage IV triple negative IDC.  She has mets to the ovary, uterus, omentum (all removed as they thought it was ovarian to start) lung ("lungs are filled with it"), brain (too many to count according to neurologist), spine, stomach and liver.  She is getting WBRT now.  She is fading before our eyes.  She also does not seem to grasp the severity of her condition (maybe the brain mets or WBRT??).  Her husband has asked that she have chemo after the WBRT.  He was told that it was useless, but they are going to do it.  Is there really such a point?  Will chemo do any good? Will it shorten her life? and will it make the rest of her time so unbearable it isnt worth it?  She is 52.  They never found the primary tumor.  Thanks for your help. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New here Is there a point where chemo does not make sense CGA luvmywife

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2011 06:21AM CGA wrote: Thanks all. Sometime last night I came to the conclusion that whatever she wants to believe is where I am going to stand with her.   BTW this is her initial diagnosis.  I will leave it to the docs to discuss Hospice and where it all goes from here unless she opens the discussion.  It has all been shocking (we just learned on Good Friday about all the mets outside of the brain).  Things seem to change on a daily basis.  Part of me feels bad about this because we have always had this really open relationship and she asked me never to lie to her when she first came out of surgery.  But when I lead into discussions about what she has been told, she leads right out.  So I will follow her.  I am open to suggestions from all of you tho. Thanks again!
